data.Name: Hassler-Brunner
data.Description: This method involves sealing the end faces of a cylindrical core sample with a flexible, impermeable membrane, ensuring that fluid flows only through the pore spaces and not around the core, using confining pressure to maintain the seal.

data.Name: Forbes
data.Description: The Forbes method uses a rigid, impermeable plate to seal the end faces of the core sample, ensuring an accurate seal especially suitable for very fine or ultra-low permeability samples where flexible membranes may not suffice.
